tomato.care: Water regularly, provide full sun, and support with stakes or cages.

potato.care: Plant in well-drained soil, hill up soil around stems as they grow.

corn.care: Requires consistent moisture and nitrogen-rich soil.

apple.care: Prune annually, thin fruit for better size, protect from pests.

rice.care: Maintain consistent water levels, ensure proper drainage during certain growth stages.

wheat.care: Plant in well-drained soil, provide adequate nitrogen fertilization.

cucumber.care: Provide trellising, consistent moisture, and good air circulation.

pepper.care: Requires warm soil, consistent moisture, and calcium-rich soil.

general_care.watering: Most crops need 1-2 inches of water per week. Water deeply and less frequently.
general_care.fertilizing: Use balanced fertilizer for most crops. Nitrogen promotes leaf growth, phosphorus for roots and fruits.
general_care.pest_control: Regularly inspect plants, use organic methods first, chemical pesticides as last resort.
general_care.soil_health: Maintain organic matter in soil, rotate crops, and test soil pH regularly.
general_care.pruning: Remove dead or diseased branches, improve air circulation, and control plant size and shape.
general_care.mulching: Apply 2-3 inches of mulch to conserve moisture, suppress weeds, and regulate soil temperature.
